content:
I want to file a bug report, but my bug videos are buggy and don't show up in firefox :( does anyone have suggestions for file formats I can upload on github and don't break? maybe whatever the weekly updates use?

broken-in-firefox.mp4
nice, that worked :) annoyingly low resolution but it gets the point across image.png
wow, it's surprisingly large, it's like 60 MB
yeah github rejects anything over 10 MB unfortunately :( I guess I can just put the original .avi on google drive?
I think the easiest is to upload the video somewhere and post a link
oh yay now kazam is using multiple gigabytes of memory for 30 seconds of recording :(
I think the moral here is that all software is broken
sorry for the potato quality, ffmpeg is a maze of options
@Joshua Nelson if you use Linux, highly recomment Peek. if you don't use Linux, highly recommend NixOs :-)
ok yes that worked much better! and the file was a normal size to start instead of having to use ffmpeg just to get it down from 700 MB :)
github doesn't allow webm uploads but that seems like a github issue
oh well it has not broken mp4 support, that's even better
webm also don't work with safary I believe
But yeah, as someone who've been through all of circles of hell with kazam, obs, simplescreenrecored and ffmpeg, peek is just such a great piece of software
I use OBS, the upcoming version works great on Wayland. And gifski for GIF conversion.
